-------- Původní zpráva --------
Od: "Mike Kebede (KerioControl)" <customersupport-keriocontrol@gfi.com> 
Datum: 28.10.25 13:54 (GMT+01:00) 
Komu: Milos Hofman <hofman@ziva.cz> 
Předmět: Re: Kerio Control license migration request 

 You are receiving this email because request [#60225231] [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/conversation/view/60225231] has received the below update: 

Dear Milos,

Thank you for the detailed updates and for providing the relevant logs.

The message you are seeing:

"Unable to contact AppManager: appliance does not have a valid license"

is not related to the validity of your license. This issue occurs when a configuration is restored to new hardware or a virtual environment.

To resolve this, it is necessary to reset the AppManager agent. This is the only valid solution.

Please follow the steps provided in the official article below to reset the agent:

Resetting KerioControl’s connection to GFI AppManager [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/117310-resetting-keriocontrol-s-connection-to-gfi-appmanager]

This process involves:

 	*
Clearing stored AppManager parameters

 	*
Reinstalling the GFI Agent

 	*
Restarting the services

After completing the steps, your appliance should be able to register successfully with AppManager and recognize the license correctly.

If the issue persists after following the procedure, please send us the latest Support Information File so we can continue the investigation.

Best regards,
Mike Kebede
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you. 

 Sent with Kayako [https://kayako.com] image

The message you are seeing:

is not related to the validity of your license. This issue occurs when a configuration is restored to new hardware or a virtual environment.

Kayako - ticket id 60225231 // Mike Kebede commented privately:  From Jozef:

The issue is misclassification of tickets where the error message

unable to contact AppManager: appliance does not have a valid license
is mistakenly treated as a license issue.

In reality, this occurs when the configuration file is restored on the same device or moved to a different one (for example, during a hardware refresh). This behavior is expected and happens in 100% of such cases.

Resolution:
Reset the AppManager agent — this is the only valid fix.
There is no workaround.

-------- Původní zpráva --------
Od: "Mike Kebede (KerioControl)" <customersupport-keriocontrol@gfi.com> 
Datum: 27.10.25 15:59 (GMT+01:00) 
Komu: Milos Hofman <hofman@ziva.cz> 
Předmět: Re: Kerio Control license migration request 

 You are receiving this email because request [#60225231] [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/conversation/view/60225231] has received the below update: 

Dear Milos, 

You've confirmed that DNS, outbound connectivity, and network access are all working properly. The issue is clearly with the license registration itself. 

The Root Cause: 

The license file information is incorrect or incompatible with your new Proxmox virtual environment. Since you migrated from a hardware box to Proxmox, the license file is still bound to the old hardware box's serial number and won't work properly on the new virtual appliance. 

The Solution: 

You need to obtain an updated license file that's properly bound to your new virtual environment. Here's what you need to do: 

	* Contact GFI Customer Care [https://customercare.gfi.com/hc/en-us/requests/new] and provide them with:

 	* License key: 20339-3L1LN-8977B
 	* Old Hardware box Serial Number (from the broken box, if available)
 	* Customer ID: (from your license details)
 	* Full Name: Milos Hofman
 	* Email address: hofman.500dced1d06a4f7aaba14e85e503de34@gfi.fake.ziva.cz 
 	* Country: Czech Republic
 	* Explanation: Migrated from broken hardware box to Proxmox virtual appliance, need license file updated for new environment

 	* Once you receive the updated license file from GFI Customer Care, you'll need to register it offline using the Registration Wizard in Kerio Control.

 Reference Article: Hardware box is not accepting license key [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/120230] 

Best regards,
Mike Kebede
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you. 

 Sent with Kayako [https://kayako.com] image

Kayako - ticket id 60225231 // Mike Kebede commented publicly: Dear Milos,

Thank you for sending the log files. After reviewing them, we can confirm that your license file is valid and correctly installed. However, the appliance is unable to verify it online because it cannot reach the GFI AppManager service.

The logs show repeated DNS timeouts when attempting to contact appmanager.gfi.com, which causes the message:
“Unable to contact AppManager: appliance does not have valid license.”

Please follow the steps below to restore connectivity and complete the license validation.

	* Test DNS resolution

	* In Administration → Status → IP Tools, run:
nslookup appmanager.gfi.com
	* If this fails, update your DNS forwarding settings.
	* Reference: Troubleshooting DNS Forwarding in Kerio Control

	* Adjust DNS forwarding

	* Go to Configuration → DNS Forwarding.
	* Move a public DNS server (for example, 8.8.8.8) to the top of the list and apply the changes.
	* Reference: Configuring DNS Forwarding in Kerio Control

	* Verify outbound access

	* Make sure that the Firewall host can reach the Internet on ports 53 (DNS) and 443 (HTTPS).
	* Reference: Allowing Kerio Control to Access the Internet

	* Restart the GFI Agent service

	* Go to Status → System Health → Services, then restart GFI Agent.
	* Reference: Understanding the GFI Agent Service in Kerio Control

After applying these changes, open Logs → License and confirm if you see:
Successfully connected to AppManager

If the issue persists, please download a new Support Information File (Administration → System Health → Support → Download Support Information) and attach it to this ticket for further review.

Best regards,
Mike Kebede
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60225231 // Mike Kebede commented publicly: Dear Milos,

Thank you for your update. The license.key file has already been attached to this ticket. Please register it offline to confirm that the appliance accepts it correctly.

Please follow these steps:

	* Open Administration → Configuration → Registration.
	* Click Register offline using license file and select the attached license.key.
	* After completing the wizard, go to Status → System Health → Services and restart the GFI Agent service (or restart the appliance).
	* Verify under Dashboard → License that the company name Ziva a.s. and the expiry date 2025-11-09 are displayed.

If the registration still fails or the error persists, please download the Support Information File from Administration → System Health → Support → Download Support Information and attach it to this ticket. This file includes all required diagnostic data such as license.log, gfiagent.log, and system information for analysis.

Once we review the file, we will advise on the next steps.

Best regards,
Mike Kebede
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

 I see what's happening. This error typically occurs when there's an issue with the license file information or a mismatch between the license and your appliance. Let me help you troubleshoot this:

HERE'S WHAT TYPICALLY CAUSES THIS ERROR:

Based on the knowledge base, this error happens when:

 	* The license file information is incorrect or doesn't match your system
 	* There's a mismatch between the license and the appliance type (software vs hardware)
 	* The license might still be bound to a different system

LET'S TRY THIS SOLUTION:

Step 1: Download a fresh license file

 	* Go to the Kerio Product Registration page [https://www.kerio.com/support/kerio-control]

-------------------------
 If this still doesn't work, you'll need to contact the GFI Customer Care team to get an updated license file. They'll need this information from you:

Since you have:

Let's try to narrow this down:

When you try to import the license.key file into Kerio Control:

 Thank you for those details! This makes sense now. When you migrate Kerio Control to new hardware, the license is tied to the specific hardware/OS configuration, so you're getting that invalid license for appliance error because your existing license is still bound to the old broken hardware.

Here's what you need to do:

SOLUTION: HARDWARE/OS MODEL CHANGE

Since you're migrating to new hardware with a valid existing license, you need to request a hardware model change for your license. This will unbind the license from the old hardware and allow it to work on your new appliance.

Here's the process:

 	* Update your license via this article: How can I update my Kerio Connect or Kerio Control OS or Hardware model? [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/120220] 

 	* If you encounter any issues, you can contact the GFI Customer Care Center [https://customercare.gfi.com/hc/en-us/requests/new] and provide: 

- Your license key
- New hardware box Serial Number (SN)
- Customer ID
- Full Name
- Email address registered in the license details
- Country
- (Optional but helpful) Previous hardware SN or license key

Once the hardware model change is processed, you'll receive an updated license key that will work with your new appliance. After that, the old unit will stop working with that license (which is fine since it's broken anyway).

Important: Make sure you have a backup of your configuration from the old appliance so you can restore it to the new one after the license is updated!

Do you have a backup of your configuration from the old hardware, or do we need to address that as well? 🔧
